meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: The Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

main.longTitle: An Ordinance to establish a Travel Industry Authority; to provide for the licensing of travel agents, tourist guides and tour escorts; to regulate the activities of the licensees; to provide for the administration of the Travel Industry Compensation Fund, and for the imposition of levies on travel agents; and to provide for related matters.

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Travel Industry Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance—
subsection.def: appeal board (上訴委員會) means an appeal board appointed under section 121;
Authority (旅監局) means the Travel Industry Authority established by section 150;

authorized representative (獲授權代表), in relation to a licensed travel agent, means—(a)the individual who becomes the travel agent’s authorized representative under section 26(2); or(b)the individual who is approved as the travel agent’s authorized representative under section 31(3) or 110(3);
business permit (業務許可證) means a business permit issued under section 10(1);

company (公司) means—(a)a company formed and registered under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);(b)a company formed and registered under a former Companies Ordinance as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); or(c)a body corporate established or incorporated outside Hong Kong;
company secretary (公司秘書) includes any person occupying the position of company secretary (by whatever name called);
Compensation Fund (賠償基金) means the fund that is—(a)established by section 32C of the repealed Ordinance as the Travel Industry Compensation Fund; and(b)continued under section 139(2);
controller (控權人)—see subsection (3);
disciplinary committee (紀律委員會) means the disciplinary committee established under section 86(1);
disclosable interest (應披露利害關係)—see subsection (4);
Executive Director (行政總裁) means the Executive Director of the Authority appointed under section 7(1)(a) of Schedule 9;
function (職能) includes power and duty;
identity card (身分證) has the meaning given by section 1A(1) of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177);
inquiry committee (研訊委員會) means an inquiry committee established under section 98(2)(a);

legal representative (法律代表), in relation to a party to an inquiry under Part 7 or an appeal under Part 8, means a solicitor or counsel who holds a practising certificate and represents the party at the inquiry or appeal;
licence (牌照) means—(a)a travel agent licence;(b)a tourist guide licence; or(c)a tour escort licence;
licensed tour escort (持牌領隊) means the holder of a tour escort licence;
licensed tourist guide (持牌導遊) means the holder of a tourist guide licence;
licensed travel agent (持牌旅行代理商) means the holder of a travel agent licence;
licensee (持牌人) means the holder of a licence;
local place of business (本地營業地點) means a place of business in Hong Kong to which the public ordinarily have physical access;
Mainland (內地) means any part of China other than Hong Kong, Macao and Taiwan;
Mainland inbound tour group (內地入境旅行團) means a tour group to Hong Kong from the Mainland;
Mainland travel agent (內地旅行代理商) means a person who carries on the business of organizing Mainland inbound tour groups in the Mainland;

manager (管理人), in relation to a company—(a)means a person who performs managerial functions in relation to the company under the directors’ immediate authority; but(b)excludes—(i)a receiver or manager of the company’s property; and(ii)a special manager of the company’s estate or business appointed under section 216 of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32);
non-trade member (非業界成員) means an individual who is not a trade member;
permanent identity card (永久性居民身分證) has the meaning given by section 1A(1) of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177);
prescribed (訂明) means prescribed by regulations made under section 163;
previous licence (先前牌照) means a licence granted under the repealed Ordinance;
register (登記冊), in relation to licences, means the register kept under section 62;
repealed Ordinance (《已廢除條例》) means the Travel Agents Ordinance (Cap. 218) repealed by section 3 of Schedule 11;
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Culture, Sports and Tourism; (Amended L.N. 144 of 2022)
tour escort licence (領隊牌照) means a tour escort licence issued under section 42(1);
tour escort pass (領隊證) means a pass issued by the Travel Industry Council under the Outbound Tour Escort Accreditation System set up by the Council;
tourist guide licence (導遊牌照) means a tourist guide licence issued under section 42(1);
tourist guide pass (導遊證) means a pass issued by the Travel Industry Council under the Tourist Guide Accreditation System set up by the Council;
Travel Industry Council (旅遊業議會) has the meaning given by section 32A(1) of the repealed Ordinance;
Vice-chairperson (副主席) means the Vice-chairperson of the Authority referred to in section 1(1)(b) of Schedule 9;
working group (工作小組), in relation to the Authority, means a working group established under section 32(1) of Schedule 9.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a person carrying on travel agent business is to be construed under section 4;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a person carrying on Mainland inbound tour group business is to be construed under section 5;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a reference to a person working as a tourist guide is to be construed under section 37; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a reference to a person working as a tour escort is to be construed under section 38.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a person is the controller of a company if the directors, or a majority of the directors, of the company are accustomed to act in accordance with the person’s directions (excluding advice given in a professional capacity).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a person has a disclosable interest in a matter (however described) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the person has, in relation to the matter—

subparagraph.content: a pecuniary interest (whether direct or indirect); or
a personal interest greater than that which the person has as a member of the public; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the pecuniary interest or personal interest could conflict or could reasonably be perceived to conflict with the proper performance of the person’s functions under this Ordinance.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Exemption
section.content: The Authority may, by notice published in the Gazette, exempt a person or class of persons from the operation of this Ordinance subject to any conditions or limitations specified in the notice.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Meaning of carrying on travel agent business

subsection.leadIn: A person carries on travel agent business if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the person carries on any of the following business activities in Hong Kong—

subparagraph.content: obtaining for another person accommodation at a place outside Hong Kong;

subparagraph.leadIn: obtaining for a visitor to Hong Kong carriage, by any means of transport, on a journey that is to—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: commence outside Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: either terminate in Hong Kong or involve the visitor passing through immigration controls before leaving Hong Kong;
obtaining for a visitor to Hong Kong accommodation in Hong Kong;

subparagraph.leadIn: obtaining for a visitor to Hong Kong any of the following services—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a service providing sightseeing or visits to local places of interest;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a service providing restaurant meals or other catered meals;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a service providing shopping trips;

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: a service providing local transport in connection with any of the services described in sub-subparagraphs (A), (B) and (C); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person—

subparagraph.content: carries on any of the business activities described in paragraph (a)(i) and (ii) at a place outside Hong Kong; and
actively markets, whether or not through another person and whether in Hong Kong or from a place outside Hong Kong, to the public of Hong Kong any of those business activities.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to a person falling within paragraph (a) or (b) of the subsection if the Authority considers that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person’s principal business is not the carrying on of the business activities described in the paragraph; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the relevant business activity carried on by the person is ancillary to the person’s principal business.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether a business activity is ancillary to a person’s principal business, the Authority must have regard to all relevant matters, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature of the activity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the frequency of the activity; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the direct or indirect financial contribution of the activity towards the person.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (2), a person does not carry on travel agent business—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of a business activity described in subsection (1)(a)(ii) if—

subparagraph.content: the person is the operator of the relevant accommodation; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of a business activity described in subsection (1)(a)(iv) if—

subparagraph.content: the person is the operator of the relevant accommodation; or
(whether or not subparagraph (i) is applicable) the relevant accommodation obtained by the person for the visitor is intended to be occupied by that visitor for 28 or more days; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in respect of a business activity described in subsection (1)(a)(v) if the person is the owner or operator of the relevant service.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Meaning of carrying on Mainland inbound tour group business
section.leadIn: A person carries on Mainland inbound tour group business if the person obtains any of the following services for a Mainland inbound tour group organized by a Mainland travel agent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a service providing sightseeing or visits to local places of interest;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a service providing restaurant meals or other catered meals;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a service providing shopping trips;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a service providing local transport in connection with any of the services described in paragraphs (a), (b) and (c).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: approved Mainland travel agent (核准內地旅行代理商) means a Mainland travel agent that is approved to carry on the business of organizing Mainland inbound tour groups by a regulatory organization in the Mainland that regulates the travel industry of the Mainland.

subsection.content: No person may, without a travel agent licence, carry on travel agent business.

subsection.leadIn: A licensed travel agent must not carry on travel agent business—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at any local place of business in respect of which the travel agent does not have a business permit; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: otherwise than in accordance with the conditions imposed on the travel agent licence concerned.

subsection.content: A licensed travel agent must not obtain any of the services described in section 5(a), (b), (c) and (d) for a Mainland inbound tour group organized by a Mainland travel agent unless the Mainland travel agent is an approved Mainland travel agent.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2), (3) or (4) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a defendant charged with an offence against subsection (4) to establish that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: all practicable steps were taken by the defendant to determine whether the Mainland travel agent was an approved Mainland travel agent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it was reasonable for the defendant to determine that the Mainland travel agent was an approved Mainland travel agent.

subsection.leadIn: The defendant is taken to have established a matter that needs to be established for the defence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue with respect to that matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

subsection.content: If a person intends to carry on travel agent business, the person may apply for a travel agent licence.

subsection.leadIn: An application for a travel agent licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made to the Authority in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state the correspondence address and electronic mail address of the applicant; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must be accompanied by—

subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee; and
any document the Authority may require.

subsection.content: The Authority may, on application, issue a travel agent licence to a company, a partnership or an individual carrying on business as a sole proprietor.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not issue a travel agent licence unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority is satisfied that—

subparagraph.content: the applicant is a company, a partnership or an individual carrying on business as a sole proprietor;
the applicant is suitable to hold the licence having regard to the matters set out in Division 4;
the applicant meets the capital requirement set out in Division 5;
the applicant meets the guarantee money requirement set out in Division 6; and
the applicant meets the authorized representative requirement set out in Division 7; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has paid the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: A travel agent licence must be in the specified form.
A travel agent licence is not transferable.
The Authority may impose on a travel agent licence the conditions, including prescribed conditions, that it considers appropriate.
The Authority must specify in a travel agent licence the validity period of the licence.
The period specified under subsection (6) must not be longer than 12 months beginning on the date on which the licence is issued.
If a licensed travel agent intends to carry on travel agent business at a local place of business, the travel agent may apply for a business permit in respect of that place.

subsection.leadIn: An application for a business permit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made to the Authority in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state the address of the local place of business at which the applicant intends to carry on travel agent business; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must be accompanied by—

subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee; and
any document the Authority may require.

subsection.content: The Authority may, on application, issue a business permit to a licensed travel agent in respect of the local place of business stated in the application.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not issue a business permit unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant holds a valid travel agent licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority is satisfied that the local place of business stated in the application, and the location of the place, are suitable for travel agent business; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant has paid the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: A business permit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must specify the address of the local place of business at which the applicant is permitted to carry on travel agent business.

subsection.content: A business permit is not transferable.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, when issuing a business permit to the applicant, do one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend or remove the existing conditions of the travel agent licence of the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose new conditions on the travel agent licence.

subsection.content: The Authority must specify in a business permit the validity period of the permit.
The period specified under subsection (6) must not be longer than the validity period of the travel agent licence of the applicant.

section.name: s11
section.heading: What travel agent licence or business permit permits

subsection.content: A travel agent licence permits the person named in the licence to carry on travel agent business.
A business permit permits the person named in the permit to carry on travel agent business at the local place of business specified in the permit.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Refusal to issue travel agent licence or business permit

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority intends to refuse to issue a travel agent licence or business permit, it must, by notice in writing given to the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the applicant of the intention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give reasons for the intention.

subsection.content: The applicant may, within 7 days after the date of the notice, or a longer period the Authority may permit, make representations in writing to the Authority as to why the Authority should not refuse to issue the travel agent licence or business permit.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority decides not to issue a travel agent licence or business permit, it must, by notice in writing given to the applicant within 21 days beginning on the date on which the decision is made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the applicant of the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give reasons for the decision.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Application for renewal of travel agent licence or business permit

subsection.content: A licensed travel agent may apply for the renewal of the travel agent licence or business permit concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made to the Authority in the specified form within the period specified in section 1(1) of Schedule 1; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by—

subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee; and
any document the Authority may require.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Renewal of travel agent licence or business permit

subsection.content: The Authority may, on application, renew a travel agent licence or business permit.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not renew a travel agent licence unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority is satisfied that—

subparagraph.content: the applicant is suitable to hold the licence having regard to the matters set out in Division 4;
the applicant meets the guarantee money requirement set out in Division 6; and
the applicant meets the authorized representative requirement set out in Division 7; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has paid the prescribed fee.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not renew a business permit unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant holds a valid travel agent licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority is satisfied that the local place of business stated in the application, and the location of the place, are suitable for travel agent business; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant has paid the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: A renewed travel agent licence must be in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: A renewed business permit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must specify the address of the local place of business at which the applicant is permitted to carry on travel agent business.

subsection.content: A renewed travel agent licence or renewed business permit is not transferable.
The Authority may impose on a renewed travel agent licence the conditions, including prescribed conditions, that it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, when renewing a business permit of the applicant, do one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend or remove the existing conditions of the travel agent licence of the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose new conditions on the travel agent licence.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the validity period of a renewed travel agent licence in the licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the validity period of a renewed business permit in the permit.

subsection.leadIn: The period specified under subsection (9)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a renewed travel agent licence, must not be longer than 12 months beginning on the date on which the licence is renewed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a renewed business permit, must not be longer than the validity period of the travel agent licence of the applicant.

subsection.content: A travel agent licence or business permit may be renewed more than once.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Refusal to renew travel agent licence or business permit

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority intends to refuse to renew a travel agent licence or business permit, it must, by notice in writing given to the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the applicant of the intention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give reasons for the intention.

subsection.content: The applicant may, within 7 days after the date of the notice, or a longer period the Authority may permit, make representations in writing to the Authority as to why the Authority should not refuse to renew the travel agent licence or business permit.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority decides not to renew a travel agent licence or business permit, it must, by notice in writing given to the applicant within 21 days beginning on the date on which the decision is made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the applicant of the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give reasons for the decision.

section.name: s16
section.heading: No fresh application for travel agent licence etc. within prescribed period after refusal

subsection.content: This section applies to a person whose application for a travel agent licence or business permit, or the renewal of a travel agent licence or business permit, has been refused.
The person may not reapply for a travel agent licence or business permit, or the renewal of a travel agent licence or business permit, within the prescribed period.

Despite subsection (2), the Authority may permit the person to reapply for a travel agent licence or business permit, or the renewal of a travel agent licence or business permit, within the prescribed period if the Authority is satisfied that the ground for the refusal no longer exists.

section.name: s17
section.heading: No fresh application for travel agent licence etc. within prescribed period after revocation

subsection.content: This section applies to a person whose travel agent licence or business permit has been revoked.
The person may not reapply for a travel agent licence or business permit within the prescribed period.

Despite subsection (2), the Authority may permit the person to reapply for a travel agent licence or business permit within the prescribed period if the Authority is satisfied that exceptional circumstances exist that justify the permission.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Suitability requirement for applicant for travel agent licence or renewal of travel agent licence

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: associated company (有聯繫公司), in relation to a company, means—(a)a subsidiary of the company;(b)a holding company of the company; or(c)a subsidiary of the holding company mentioned in paragraph (b).

subsection.leadIn: In determining for the purposes of sections 8(2)(a)(ii) and 14(2)(a)(i) whether a company is suitable to hold a travel agent licence, the Authority must have regard to all relevant matters, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the matters set out in Schedule 2;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether every officer and controller of the company is suitable to be associated with the business of a travel agent; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: any information in the possession of the Authority, whether provided by the company or not, on any matters relating to an associated company of the company, including—

subparagraph.content: the matters set out in Schedule 2; and
whether every officer and controller of the associated company is suitable to be associated with the business of a travel agent.

subsection.leadIn: In determining for the purposes of sections 8(2)(a)(ii) and 14(2)(a)(i) whether a partnership is suitable to hold a travel agent licence, the Authority must have regard to all relevant matters, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the matters set out in Schedule 3; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether every person responsible or proposed to be responsible for the management of the travel agent business of the partnership, or any part of the business, is suitable to be associated with the business of a travel agent.

subsection.leadIn: In determining for the purposes of sections 8(2)(a)(ii) and 14(2)(a)(i) whether an individual is suitable to hold a travel agent licence, the Authority must have regard to all relevant matters, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the matters set out in section 1(1) of Schedule 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether every person responsible or proposed to be responsible for the management of the travel agent business of the individual, or any part of the business, is suitable to be associated with the business of a travel agent.

subsection.leadIn: In determining for the purposes of subsections (2)(b), (3)(b) and (4)(b) whether a person is suitable to be associated with the business of a travel agent, the Authority must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person is a company, have regard to all relevant matters, including the matters set out in Schedule 2;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is a partnership, have regard to all relevant matters, including the matters set out in Schedule 3; and

paragraph.name: c

section.name: s19
section.heading: Capital requirement for applicant for travel agent licence

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified capital amount (指明資本額) means the amount specified in Schedule 5.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 8(2)(a)(iii), the capital requirement for an applicant is that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the applicant is a company, the amount of the company’s paid-up share capital must not be less than the specified capital amount;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: if the applicant is an individual, the amount in the individual’s capital account must not be less than the specified capital amount.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Purpose of guarantee money
section.content: The purpose of guarantee money is to guarantee the settlement of any financial penalties imposed on a licensed travel agent under Part 7 or 8.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Guarantee money requirement for applicant for travel agent licence or renewal of travel agent licence

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an applicant for a travel agent licence under section 7; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an applicant for the renewal of a travel agent licence under section 13.

subsection.content: However, this section does not apply to a person who is taken to be a licensed travel agent under Schedule 10.

For the purposes of sections 8(2)(a)(iv) and 14(2)(a)(ii), the guarantee money requirement for an applicant is that the applicant must deposit guarantee money with the Authority in accordance with this section.
The amount of the guarantee money is to be the amount specified for level 2 in Schedule 6.

The guarantee money is to be in the form of a bank guarantee, in terms acceptable to the Authority, from an authorized institution within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155).

subsection.leadIn: The period for which the guarantee money is to be deposited is the period specified by the Authority which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an applicant for a travel agent licence, may be longer than the validity period of the licence, if issued; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an applicant for the renewal of a travel agent licence, may be longer than the validity period of the licence, if renewed.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Guarantee money requirement for person taken to be licensed travel agent under Schedule 10

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: pre-existing controller (原有控權人)—(a)in relation to a company, means a person who, directly or indirectly, is entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, the voting rights at a general meeting of the company immediately before the commencement date; or(b)in relation to a partnership, means a person who, directly or indirectly, is entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, the voting rights in the partnership immediately before the commencement date;
pre-existing shareholder (原有股東), in relation to a company, means a person who is a shareholder of the company immediately before the commencement date;
specified misconduct (指明不當行為), in relation to a person, means a contravention by the person of a requirement in this Ordinance that is specified by the Authority.

subsection.content: This section applies to a person who is taken to be a licensed travel agent under Schedule 10.

The guarantee money requirement for a person to whom this section applies is that if the Authority requires the person to do so, the person must deposit guarantee money in accordance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount or aggregated amount of financial penalties imposed under Parts 7 and 8 on a person to whom this section applies exceeds the level specified by the Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the frequency of specified misconduct by a person to whom this section applies exceeds the level specified by the Authority,

subsection.continued: the Authority may require the person to deposit guarantee money of the amount specified for level 1 in Schedule 6 in accordance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person to whom this section applies is a company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on or after the commencement date—

subparagraph.content: the total voting rights which the pre-existing controllers are entitled to exercise, or the exercise of which the pre-existing controllers are entitled to control, at a general meeting of the company become less than 50% of the voting rights in the company,

subsection.continued: the Authority may require the company to deposit guarantee money of the amount specified for level 2 in Schedule 6 in accordance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person to whom this section applies is a partnership; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on or after the commencement date—

subparagraph.content: the total entitlement of the pre-existing partners in the capital or profits of the partnership becomes less than 50% of the capital or profits of the partnership; or

the total voting rights which the pre-existing controllers are entitled to exercise, or the exercise of which the pre-existing controllers are entitled to control, in the partnership become less than 50% of the voting rights in the partnership,

subsection.continued: the Authority may require the partnership to deposit guarantee money of the amount specified for level 2 in Schedule 6 in accordance with this section.

subsection.content: Subject to section 23, if a person who has deposited guarantee money under subsection (4) applies for the renewal of the person’s travel agent licence under section 13, the Authority may require the person to deposit guarantee money of the amount specified for level 1 in Schedule 6 in accordance with this section.

If a person who has deposited guarantee money under subsection (5) or (6) applies for the renewal of the person’s travel agent licence under section 13, the Authority may require the person to deposit guarantee money of the amount specified for level 2 in Schedule 6 in accordance with this section.

The guarantee money is to be in the form of a bank guarantee, in terms acceptable to the Authority, from an authorized institution within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155).

subsection.leadIn: The period for which the guarantee money is to be deposited is the period specified by the Authority which—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: for the guarantee money required under subsection (7) or (8), may be longer than the validity period of the relevant travel agent licence, if renewed.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Additional guarantee money requirement for person taken to be licensed travel agent under Schedule 10

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified misconduct (指明不當行為) has the meaning given by section 22(1).

subsection.content: This section applies to a person who has deposited guarantee money under section 22(4).

The guarantee money requirement for a person to whom this section applies is that if the Authority requires the person to do so, the person must deposit guarantee money in accordance with this section.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the amount or aggregated amount of financial penalties imposed under Parts 7 and 8 on a person to whom this section applies exceeds the level specified by the Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the frequency of specified misconduct by a person to whom this section applies exceeds the level specified by the Authority,

subsection.continued: the Authority may require the person to deposit additional guarantee money of the amount specified for level 1 in Schedule 6 in accordance with this section.

subsection.content: If a person who has deposited additional guarantee money under subsection (4) applies for the renewal of the person’s travel agent licence under section 13, the Authority may require the person to deposit guarantee money of the amount specified for level 2 in Schedule 6 in accordance with this section.

The guarantee money is to be in the form of a bank guarantee, in terms acceptable to the Authority, from an authorized institution within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155).

subsection.leadIn: The period for which the guarantee money is to be deposited is the period specified by the Authority which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the guarantee money required under subsection (4), may be longer than the validity period of the relevant travel agent licence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the guarantee money required under subsection (5), may be longer than the validity period of the relevant travel agent licence, if renewed.

division.name: D7
division.heading: Authorized Representative Requirement and Other Provisions

section.name: s24
section.heading: Authorized representative requirement for applicant for travel agent licence or renewal of travel agent licence

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 8(2)(a)(v) and 14(2)(a)(iii), the authorized representative requirement for an applicant is that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the application must set out—

subparagraph.content: the particulars of the individual who is proposed to be the applicant’s authorized representative; and
the individual’s consent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority approves the individual as the applicant’s authorized representative.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may approve an individual as the applicant’s authorized representative only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority is satisfied that the individual is suitable to be an authorized representative of a travel agent; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the individual is not already an authorized representative of a licensed travel agent other than the applicant.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Individual suitable to be authorized representative of travel agent

subsection.leadIn: In determining for the purposes of section 24(2)(a) whether an individual is suitable to be an authorized representative of a travel agent, the Authority must have regard to all relevant matters, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the matters set out in section 1(1) of Schedule 4;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: whether the individual is associated with the business of the travel agent in the capacity of—

subparagraph.content: a director, manager, company secretary or controller of a company;
a partner in a partnership, or a person concerned in the management of the partnership; or
a sole proprietor, or a person concerned in the management of the sole proprietorship;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether the individual has completed the courses specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether the individual meets the qualification requirement set out in Schedule 7.

subsection.content: If the Authority is not satisfied that an individual is suitable to be an authorized representative of a travel agent, the individual is also not suitable to be an authorized representative of any other travel agent within the prescribed period.

Despite subsection (2), the Authority may permit the individual to be an authorized representative of a travel agent within the prescribed period if the Authority is satisfied that the ground for determining that the individual is not suitable no longer exists.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Authorized representative of licensed travel agent

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person applies for a travel agent licence or the renewal of a travel agent licence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licence is issued or renewed.

subsection.content: The individual named in the application as authorized representative becomes the licensed travel agent’s authorized representative.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Duties of authorized representative of licensed travel agent
section.leadIn: The duties of an authorized representative of a licensed travel agent are—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: to ensure that the operation of the travel agent is in compliance with all the requirements in this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to inform the Authority of any changes in the prescribed particulars of the travel agent in the prescribed way.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Requirement to cease to be authorized representative

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may require an individual to cease to be the authorized representative of a licensed travel agent if the Authority reasonably believes that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: having regard to the matters set out in section 25(1), the individual is no longer suitable to be an authorized representative of a travel agent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the individual has failed to fulfil a duty set out in section 27.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority intends to make the requirement under subsection (1), it must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: by notice in writing given to the individual—

subparagraph.content: notify the individual of the intention; and
give reasons for the intention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: send a copy of the notice to the travel agent.

subsection.content: The individual and the travel agent may, within 7 days after the date of the notice, or a longer period the Authority may permit, make representations in writing to the Authority as to why the Authority should not make the requirement.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority decides to make the requirement, it must, within 21 days beginning on the date on which the decision is made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: by notice in writing given to the individual—

subparagraph.content: notify the individual of the decision;
give reasons for the decision; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the individual will also not be suitable to be an authorized representative of any travel agent for the period specified in the notice; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: unless the ground for making the decision no longer exists, an application for a travel agent licence, or the renewal of a travel agent licence, made during the specified period will be refused if the individual is proposed to be the applicant’s authorized representative; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by notice in writing given to the travel agent—

subparagraph.content: notify the travel agent of the decision;
give reasons for the decision; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the travel agent must, within 14 days after the date of the notice, or a longer period the Authority may permit, apply to the Authority for approval of another individual as the travel agent’s authorized representative; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if the travel agent fails to make the application within that period, or if the application is refused, the travel agent’s licence may be revoked or suspended.

subsection.content: The period specified under subsection (4)(a)(iii)(A) must be reasonable in the circumstances.

The travel agent must within 14 days after the date of the notice given to the travel agent under subsection (4)(b), or a longer period the Authority may permit, apply to the Authority for approval of an individual as the travel agent’s authorized representative.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Death or incapacity of authorized representative
section.content: If the authorized representative of a licensed travel agent dies or becomes incapable of acting, the travel agent must, within 14 days after the date on which the travel agent becomes aware of that fact, or a longer period the Authority may permit, apply to the Authority for approval of another individual as the travel agent’s authorized representative.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Change of authorized representative
section.content: If a licensed travel agent proposes, for any reason other than the death or incapacity of the travel agent’s authorized representative, another individual for approval as the travel agent’s authorized representative, the travel agent must apply to the Authority for the approval.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Application for approval of new authorized representative

subsection.leadIn: A licensed travel agent, in making an application under section 28(6), 29 or 30, must give notice in writing to the Authority, setting out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars of the individual who is proposed to be the travel agent’s authorized representative (proposed individual); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proposed individual’s consent.

subsection.content: On receiving a notice given under subsection (1), the Authority must decide whether, having regard to the matters set out in section 25(1), the proposed individual is suitable to be an authorized representative of a travel agent.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority decides that the proposed individual is suitable, it may approve the application and may do one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend or remove the existing conditions of the travel agent licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose new conditions on the travel agent licence.

subsection.content: If the Authority decides that the proposed individual is not suitable, it may refuse the application.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority intends to refuse the application, it must, by notice in writing given to the travel agent and proposed individual—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the travel agent and individual of the intention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give reasons for the intention.

subsection.content: The travel agent and proposed individual may, within 7 days after the date of the notice given under subsection (5), or a longer period the Authority may permit, make representations in writing to the Authority as to why the Authority should not refuse the application.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority decides to refuse the application, it must, within 21 days beginning on the date on which the decision is made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: by notice in writing given to the travel agent—

subparagraph.content: notify the travel agent of the decision; and
give reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by notice in writing given to the proposed individual—

subparagraph.content: notify the individual of the decision;
give reasons for the decision; and

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the individual will also not be suitable to be an authorized representative of any travel agent for the period specified in the notice; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: unless the ground for making the decision no longer exists, an application for a travel agent licence, or the renewal of a travel agent licence, made during the specified period will be refused if the individual is proposed to be the applicant’s authorized representative.

subsection.content: The period specified under subsection (7)(b)(iii)(A) must be reasonable in the circumstances.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Registration fee for Mainland inbound tour group

subsection.content: A licensed travel agent who carries on Mainland inbound tour group business must, for each Mainland inbound tour group for which the travel agent obtains services, pay a registration fee.

subsection.leadIn: The registration fee must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: calculated under the prescribed scale of fees; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: paid to the Authority in the prescribed way.

subsection.content: A licensed travel agent must not change, or permit a change of, the ownership or control of its business as a travel agent without the Authority’s prior approval in writing.
A licensed travel agent who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
A licensed travel agent who intends to change the ownership or control of its business as a travel agent must give notice in writing to the Authority.

On receiving a notice given under subsection (1), the Authority must decide whether, having regard to the matters set out in section 18, the proposed owner or controller is suitable to hold a travel agent licence.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority decides that the proposed owner or controller is suitable, it may approve the proposed change and may do one or more of the following when the change happens—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend or remove the existing conditions of the travel agent licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose new conditions on the travel agent licence.

subsection.content: If the Authority decides that the proposed owner or controller is not suitable, it may refuse to approve the proposed change.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority intends to refuse to approve the proposed change, it must, by notice in writing given to the travel agent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the travel agent of the intention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give reasons for the intention.

subsection.content: The travel agent may, within 7 days after the date of the notice given under subsection (5), or a longer period the Authority may permit, make representations in writing to the Authority as to why the Authority should not refuse to approve the proposed change.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority decides not to approve the proposed change, it must, by notice in writing given to the travel agent within 21 days beginning on the date on which the decision is made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the travel agent of the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give reasons for the decision.

subsection.content: If a business permit has been issued to a licensed travel agent, the travel agent must display the permit at a conspicuous part of the local place of business specified in the permit.

subsection.leadIn: No person may display a business permit at a local place of business unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the permit is valid;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the permit is issued to the person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the local place of business is specified in the permit.

subsection.content: If a licensed travel agent carries on travel agent business by using a website or any other communication network, the travel agent must clearly state the number of the travel agent’s licence on the website or communication network.
A person who contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Display of information about tour group

subsection.content: If a licensed travel agent arranges a vehicle for transporting a tour group, it must display, in the prescribed way, the prescribed information about the tour group on the vehicle.
A licensed travel agent who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Meaning of working as tourist guide

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: guiding service (導遊服務) means the service of providing information, description or explanation in relation to an itinerary or a place of interest in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: A person works as a tourist guide if the person accompanies a visitor to Hong Kong for the purpose of providing any guiding service to the visitor in accordance with the directions of another person who is carrying on travel agent business (whether or not that other person is a licensed travel agent).

section.name: s38
section.heading: Meaning of working as tour escort
section.content: A person works as a tour escort if the person accompanies an outbound tour group on a journey for the purpose of taking care of the participants of the tour group during the journey in accordance with the directions of another person who is carrying on travel agent business (whether or not that other person is a licensed travel agent).

subsection.content: No person may, without a tourist guide licence, work as a tourist guide.
No person may, without a tour escort licence, work as a tour escort.
A licensed tourist guide must not work as a tourist guide otherwise than in accordance with the conditions imposed on the licence.
A licensed tour escort must not work as a tour escort otherwise than in accordance with the conditions imposed on the licence.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes this section commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Prohibition on employing or engaging person without licence

subsection.leadIn: A licensed travel agent must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: employ, or otherwise engage, a person as a tourist guide who is not a licensed tourist guide; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: employ, or otherwise engage, a person as a tour escort who is not a licensed tour escort.

subsection.content: A licensed travel agent who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Application for tourist guide licence or tour escort licence

subsection.content: If a person intends to work as a tourist guide, the person may apply for a tourist guide licence.
If a person intends to work as a tour escort, the person may apply for a tour escort licence.

subsection.leadIn: An application for a tourist guide licence or tour escort licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made to the Authority in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state the correspondence address and electronic mail address of the applicant; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: must be accompanied by—

subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee; and
any document the Authority may require.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Issue of tourist guide licence or tour escort licence

subsection.content: The Authority may, on application, issue a tourist guide licence or tour escort licence to an individual.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not issue a tourist guide licence or tour escort licence unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: holds a permanent identity card; or

subparagraph.name: B

subparagraph.content: the applicant has reached the age of 18 years;
the applicant is suitable to hold the licence;
the applicant meets the education requirement set out in Schedule 8;
the applicant has completed the pre-examination training courses specified by the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has paid the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: A tourist guide licence or tour escort licence must be in the specified form.
A tourist guide licence or tour escort licence is not transferable.
The Authority may impose on a tourist guide licence or tour escort licence the conditions, including prescribed conditions, that it considers appropriate.
The Authority must specify in a tourist guide licence or tour escort licence the validity period of the licence.
The period specified under subsection (6) must not be longer than 36 months beginning on the date on which the licence is issued.

section.name: s43
section.heading: What tourist guide licence or tour escort licence permits

subsection.content: A tourist guide licence permits the individual named in the licence to work as a tourist guide.
A tour escort licence permits the individual named in the licence to work as a tour escort.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Refusal to issue tourist guide licence or tour escort licence

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority intends to refuse to issue a tourist guide licence or tour escort licence, it must, by notice in writing given to the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the applicant of the intention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give reasons for the intention.

subsection.content: The applicant may, within 7 days after the date of the notice, or a longer period the Authority may permit, make representations in writing to the Authority as to why the Authority should not refuse to issue the tourist guide licence or tour escort licence.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority decides not to issue a tourist guide licence or tour escort licence, it must, by notice in writing given to the applicant within 21 days beginning on the date on which the decision is made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the applicant of the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give reasons for the decision.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Application for renewal of tourist guide licence or tour escort licence

subsection.content: A licensed tourist guide or licensed tour escort may apply for the renewal of the tourist guide licence or tour escort licence concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made to the Authority in the specified form within the period specified in section 1(2) of Schedule 1; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by—

subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee; and
any document the Authority may require.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Renewal of tourist guide licence or tour escort licence

subsection.content: The Authority may, on application, renew a tourist guide licence or tour escort licence.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not renew a tourist guide licence or tour escort licence unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: holds a permanent identity card; or

subparagraph.name: B

subparagraph.content: the applicant is suitable to hold the licence;
for an applicant for the renewal of a tourist guide licence, the applicant has completed the Continuing Professional Development Scheme for Tourist Guides specified by the Authority; and
for an applicant for the renewal of a tour escort licence, the applicant has completed the Continuing Professional Development Scheme for Tour Escorts specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has paid the prescribed fee.

subsection.content: A renewed tourist guide licence or renewed tour escort licence must be in the specified form.
A renewed tourist guide licence or renewed tour escort licence is not transferable.
The Authority may impose on a renewed tourist guide licence or renewed tour escort licence the conditions, including prescribed conditions, that it considers appropriate.
The Authority must specify in a renewed tourist guide licence or renewed tour escort licence the validity period of the licence.
The period specified under subsection (6) must not be longer than 36 months beginning on the date on which the licence is renewed.
A tourist guide licence or tour escort licence may be renewed more than once.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Refusal to renew tourist guide licence or tour escort licence

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority intends to refuse to renew a tourist guide licence or tour escort licence, it must, by notice in writing given to the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the applicant of the intention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give reasons for the intention.

subsection.content: The applicant may, within 7 days after the date of the notice, or a longer period the Authority may permit, make representations in writing to the Authority as to why the Authority should not refuse to renew the tourist guide licence or tour escort licence.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority decides not to renew a tourist guide licence or tour escort licence, it must, by notice in writing given to the applicant within 21 days beginning on the date on which the decision is made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify the applicant of the decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give reasons for the decision.

section.name: s48
section.heading: No fresh application for tourist guide licence etc. within prescribed period after refusal

subsection.content: This section applies to a person whose application for a tourist guide licence, or the renewal of a tourist guide licence, has been refused.
The person may not reapply for a tourist guide licence, or the renewal of a tourist guide licence, within the prescribed period.

Despite subsection (2), the Authority may permit the person to reapply for a tourist guide licence, or the renewal of a tourist guide licence, within the prescribed period if the Authority is satisfied that the ground for the refusal no longer exists.

section.name: s49
section.heading: No fresh application for tour escort licence etc. within prescribed period after refusal

subsection.content: This section applies to a person whose application for a tour escort licence, or the renewal of a tour escort licence, has been refused.
The person may not reapply for a tour escort licence, or the renewal of a tour escort licence, within the prescribed period.

Despite subsection (2), the Authority may permit the person to reapply for a tour escort licence, or the renewal of a tour escort licence, within the prescribed period if the Authority is satisfied that the ground for the refusal no longer exists.

section.name: s50
section.heading: No fresh application for tourist guide licence within prescribed period after revocation

subsection.content: This section applies to a person whose tourist guide licence has been revoked.
The person may not reapply for a tourist guide licence within the prescribed period.

Despite subsection (2), the Authority may permit the person to reapply for a tourist guide licence within the prescribed period if the Authority is satisfied that exceptional circumstances exist that justify the permission.

section.name: s51
section.heading: No fresh application for tour escort licence within prescribed period after revocation

subsection.content: This section applies to a person whose tour escort licence has been revoked.
The person may not reapply for a tour escort licence within the prescribed period.

Despite subsection (2), the Authority may permit the person to reapply for a tour escort licence within the prescribed period if the Authority is satisfied that exceptional circumstances exist that justify the permission.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Individual suitable to hold tourist guide licence or tour escort licence
section.content: In determining for the purposes of sections 42(2)(a)(iii) and 46(2)(a)(ii) whether an individual is suitable to hold a tourist guide licence or tour escort licence, the Authority must have regard to all relevant matters, including the matters set out in section 1(2) of Schedule 4.

part.name: P4
part.heading: General Provisions Relating to Licences and Licensees

section.name: s53
section.heading: Duty to comply with prescribed requirements

subsection.content: A licensee must comply with prescribed requirements.
A licensed travel agent who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
A licensed tourist guide or licensed tour escort who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Duty to comply with guidelines etc.
section.content: A licensee must comply with any guidelines, directives or codes of conduct issued under section 152(2)(k).

section.name: s55
section.heading: Correspondence address and electronic mail address of licensee

subsection.content: The correspondence address and electronic mail address of a licensee are the correspondence address and electronic mail address stated in the application for the licensee’s licence until the licensee notifies the Authority of a new correspondence address or new electronic mail address under subsection (2).

If the correspondence address or electronic mail address of a licensee is changed, the licensee must, within 14 days after the change, notify the Authority in writing of the new correspondence address or new electronic mail address.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Duty to inform Authority of changes in prescribed particulars

subsection.content: A licensed tourist guide must inform the Authority of any changes in the prescribed particulars of the tourist guide in the prescribed way.
A licensed tour escort must inform the Authority of any changes in the prescribed particulars of the tour escort in the prescribed way.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Amendment to licence or business permit

subsection.content: The Authority may, on application by the person to whom a licence or business permit is issued, amend any particulars contained in the licence or permit.

subsection.leadIn: An application for an amendment must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made to the Authority in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by—

subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee; and
any document the Authority may require.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Duplicate of licence or business permit

subsection.content: The Authority may, on application by the person to whom a licence or business permit is issued, issue a duplicate of the licence or permit.

subsection.leadIn: An application for a duplicate of a licence or business permit must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made to the Authority in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: accompanied by—

subparagraph.content: the prescribed fee; and
any document the Authority may require.

subsection.content: The Authority must not issue a duplicate of a licence or business permit unless the Authority is satisfied that the original licence or original business permit has been lost, damaged or destroyed.
A duplicate of a licence or business permit has the same effect as the original licence or original business permit.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Offence relating to application for travel agent licence or business permit, etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to an application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a travel agent licence or business permit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the renewal of a travel agent licence or business permit;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a duplicate of a travel agent licence or business permit; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for amendment of any particulars contained in a travel agent licence or business permit.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the person knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the information or document is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under this section is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Offence relating to application for tourist guide licence or tour escort licence, etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to an application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a tourist guide licence or tour escort licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the renewal of a tourist guide licence or tour escort licence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a duplicate of a tourist guide licence or tour escort licence; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for amendment of any particulars contained in a tourist guide licence or tour escort licence.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the person knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the information or document is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under this section is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Effect of suspension
section.content: If a person’s licence or business permit is suspended under this Ordinance, the licence or permit is not valid during the period of suspension.

subsection.content: The Authority must keep a register of licences.

subsection.leadIn: The purpose of the register is to enable the public to ascertain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether a person is a licensed travel agent, licensed tourist guide or licensed tour escort; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the particulars of a licensed travel agent, licensed tourist guide or licensed tour escort in relation to the services provided by them.

subsection.content: The register must contain separate lists for licences issued to travel agents, tourist guides and tour escorts.

subsection.leadIn: For a travel agent licence, the register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must state—

subparagraph.content: the name and, if applicable, the business name, of the licensee;
the number of the licence;
the correspondence address and electronic mail address of the licensee;
if a business permit has been issued to the licensee, the address of the local place of business specified in the permit; and

subparagraph.leadIn: the period for which the licence is issued and, if applicable—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the period for which the licence is renewed;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the period during which the licence is suspended; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the date on which the licence is revoked; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may contain any other particulars that the Authority considers are reasonably required for the purpose specified in section 62(2).

subsection.leadIn: For a tourist guide licence or tour escort licence, the register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must state—

subparagraph.content: the name of the licensee;
the number of the licence; and

subparagraph.leadIn: the period for which the licence is issued and, if applicable—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the period for which the licence is renewed;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the period during which the licence is suspended; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the date on which the licence is revoked; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may contain any other particulars that the Authority considers are reasonably required for the purpose specified in section 62(2).

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose specified in section 62(2), the Authority must make the register available for inspection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the offices of the Authority during ordinary business hours;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: through the Internet or a similar electronic network; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other way the Authority considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: A person may, on payment of the prescribed fee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inspect the register at the offices of the Authority during ordinary business hours and take copies of it; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: obtain a copy, certified by the Executive Director as correct, of any particulars contained in the register.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Certified copies to be admissible as evidence

subsection.content: The Executive Director may certify a copy of any particulars contained in the register as correct (certified copy).

subsection.leadIn: In any legal proceedings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless the contrary is proved, the certified copy is evidence of the particulars contained in the register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is not necessary to prove a signature on the certified copy, or to prove that the signature is that of the person holding the office of Executive Director on the date of the copy.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 6
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: enforcement officer (執法人員) means—(a)an immigration officer, or immigration assistant, within the meaning of section 2(1) of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115); or(b)a police officer;
inspector (查察員) means an inspector appointed under section 68(1);
investigator (調查員) means an investigator appointed under section 72(1);
licensee (持牌人) includes a person who was the holder of a licence;
prohibition order (禁止離境令) means an order made under section 78(3);
subject person (禁令對象), in relation to a prohibition order, means the person against whom the order is made.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Authority’s power to conduct inspection
section.content: The Authority may conduct an inspection for the purpose of ascertaining whether a licensee is complying with, has complied with, or is likely to comply with, the requirements in this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Authority may in writing appoint any of its employees, or any other person, as an inspector to conduct an inspection under section 67.
When exercising a power under this Division, an inspector must produce evidence of the inspector’s identity, and of the inspector’s appointment, to any person who requests the inspector to do so.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Power to enter and inspect, etc.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: premises (處所) does not include—(a)domestic premises; or(b)premises occupied by or provided to a participant of an inbound tour group for sleeping.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of conducting an inspection under section 67, an inspector may, at any reasonable time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter and inspect any local place of business if the inspector reasonably suspects that travel agent business is being carried on at that place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: enter and inspect any premises if the inspector reasonably suspects that—

subparagraph.content: the books of account of a licensed travel agent are kept at the premises; or
a licensed travel agent has arranged an inbound tour group to visit the premises;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: stop, board and inspect any vehicle or vessel that the inspector reasonably suspects to be arranged by a licensee for transporting a tour group;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: require—

subparagraph.content: any person at the premises referred to in paragraph (b)(i) to provide the inspector with the books of account for inspection;
any person at the premises referred to in paragraph (b)(ii) to provide the inspector with any information or document relating to the operation of the inbound tour group for inspection; and
any person whom the inspector reasonably suspects to be working as a tourist guide or tour escort to produce the person’s licence and identity card for inspection; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: make any examination and inquiry that the inspector considers necessary for the purposes of the inspection.

subsection.leadIn: The power under subsection (2) to require a person to provide information or a document includes—

paragraph.name: a

subparagraph.content: in a visible and legible form; or
in a form from which it can readily be produced in a visible and legible form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the information or document is stored electronically, the power to require—

subparagraph.content: the provision of directions on the operation of the equipment containing the information or document; and
the provision of the appropriate system for reducing the information or document into a written form on paper.

subsection.leadIn: The power under subsection (2) to require a person to provide a document includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the document is provided, the power—

subparagraph.content: to make copies of it or to take extracts from it; or
to require the person, or another person whom the inspector reasonably believes is able to do so, to give an explanation of, or further particulars about, the document; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the document is not provided, the power to require the person to state, to the best of the person’s knowledge and belief, where it is.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Complaints
section.leadIn: A person may lodge a complaint with the Authority alleging that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person has contravened a requirement in this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a licensee is not suitable to hold the licensee’s licence; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the act or conduct of a licensee is contrary to the public interest, or brings the travel industry of Hong Kong into disrepute.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Authority’s power to conduct investigation
section.leadIn: The Authority may conduct an investigation if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority has received a complaint under section 70; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority reasonably suspects that—

subparagraph.content: a person has contravened a requirement in this Ordinance;
a licensee is not suitable to hold the licensee’s licence; or
the act or conduct of a licensee is contrary to the public interest, or brings the travel industry of Hong Kong into disrepute.

subsection.content: The Authority may in writing appoint any of its employees, or any other person, as an investigator to conduct an investigation under section 71.

subsection.leadIn: When exercising a power under this Division, an investigator must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produce evidence of the investigator’s identity, and of the investigator’s appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a warrant has been issued to the investigator under section 75, produce the warrant,

subsection.continued: to any person who requests the investigator to do so.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Power to obtain information and documents

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if an investigator reasonably suspects that, in relation to an investigation conducted under section 71, a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has or may have possession or control of information or documents relevant to the investigation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may otherwise be able to assist the investigator in relation to the investigation.

subsection.leadIn: The investigator may, by notice in writing given to the person, require the person—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: to answer any written question relating to a matter the investigator reasonably believes to be relevant to the investigation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to make a statement relating to a matter the investigator reasonably believes to be relevant to the investigation; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to give the investigator all the assistance that the investigator reasonably requires for the investigation.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (2) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be signed by the Executive Director; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: indicate the subject matter and purpose of the investigation.

subsection.leadIn: The investigator may also specify in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the time and place at which the information or document is to be provided; and

paragraph.name: b
