subsection.leadIn: Despite section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), on and after the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Appeal Board of the Travel Industry Council ceases to have power to deal with the appeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appeal may instead only be dealt with by an appeal board under Part 8 as if the appeal were made under that Part.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b), Part 8, with necessary modifications, applies in relation to the appeal.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Determination of appeal on or after commencement date

subsection.content: If a decision not to issue or renew a tourist guide pass or tour escort pass is confirmed by an appeal board on or after the commencement date under Part 8, the Authority must act in accordance with the decision by reference to the applicable rules when the decision of the appeal board takes effect.

If a decision not to issue or renew a tourist guide pass is reversed by an appeal board on or after the commencement date under Part 8, the Authority must issue a tourist guide licence to the appellant and, accordingly, the appellant is taken to be a licensed tourist guide.

If a decision not to issue or renew a tour escort pass is reversed by an appeal board on or after the commencement date under Part 8, the Authority must issue a tour escort licence to the appellant and, accordingly, the appellant is taken to be a licensed tour escort.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Application for Renewal of Pre-existing Pass Taken to be Licence etc.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Application for renewal of pre-existing tourist guide pass taken to be tourist guide licence etc.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified licence (指明牌照) means—(a)a pre-existing tourist guide pass that is taken to be a tourist guide licence under section 14(1) or 21(2) of this Schedule; or(b)a tourist guide licence issued under section 16(2), 18(2) or 24(2) of this Schedule.

subsection.content: Sections 45 and 46 (except subsection (2)(a)) apply to the first application of the holder of a specified licence for the renewal of the licence.

subsection.leadIn: Also, the Authority must not renew the specified licence unless the Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant—

subparagraph.content: holds a permanent identity card; or
holds an identity card (other than a permanent identity card), and is not subject to any condition of stay that prohibits the applicant from working as a tourist guide;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant is suitable to hold a tourist guide licence;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the applicant has passed the licensing examination of tourist guides, or completed the training course, specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the applicant has completed the Continuing Professional Development Scheme for Tourist Guides specified by the Authority.

subsection.content: Sections 45 and 46 apply to any subsequent application for the renewal of the specified licence.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Application for renewal of pre-existing tour escort pass taken to be tour escort licence etc.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified licence (指明牌照) means—(a)a pre-existing tour escort pass that is taken to be a tour escort licence under section 15(1) or 21(3) of this Schedule; or(b)a tour escort licence issued under section 17(2), 19(2) or 24(3) of this Schedule.

subsection.content: Sections 45 and 46 (except subsection (2)(a)) apply to the first application of the holder of a specified licence for the renewal of the licence.

subsection.leadIn: Also, the Authority must not renew the specified licence unless the Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant—

subparagraph.content: holds a permanent identity card; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant is suitable to hold a tour escort licence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant holds a valid certificate of competency in first aid, or another similar certificate, issued by an institution specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the applicant has passed the licensing examination of tour escorts, or completed the training course, specified by the Authority.

subsection.content: Sections 45 and 46 apply to any subsequent application for the renewal of the specified licence.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Licence is subject to conditions imposed by Authority

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
d
paragraph.content: a tour escort licence issued under section 17(2), 19(2) or 24(3) of this Schedule.

subsection.content: A licence to which this section applies is subject to any condition that the Authority imposes.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, at any time during the validity period of the licence, by notice in writing given to the holder of the licence, do one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend or remove the existing conditions of the licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose new conditions on the licence.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority amends, removes or imposes a condition under subsection (3), the amendment, removal or imposition takes effect on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date of the notice given under that subsection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later date is specified in the notice, the later date.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 4
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: *specified date (指明日期) means the commencement date of section 3 of Schedule 11.

subsection.content: If, immediately before the specified date, an act is being done by the Registrar, the act may be continued by the Authority on and after that date in accordance with the repealed Ordinance as if section 3 of Schedule 11 had not been enacted.
If, immediately before the specified date, an act is being done in relation to the Registrar, the act is to be continued in relation to the Authority on and after that date.

subsection.leadIn: If, immediately before the specified date, any legal proceedings to which the Registrar is a party are pending, on and after that date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority is substituted as a party to the proceedings in lieu of the Registrar; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proceedings are to continue as if the Authority had always been the party.

subsection.leadIn: If, immediately before the specified date, any legal proceedings instituted on behalf of the Registrar are pending, on and after that date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority is substituted as a party to the proceedings in lieu of the Registrar; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proceedings are to continue as if the Authority had always been the party.

subsection.leadIn: If a form, document, instrument or act—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been issued, made or done by or on behalf of the Registrar; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is in force immediately before the specified date, or is to take effect on or after that date,

subsection.continued: it has effect as if it had been issued, made or done by or on behalf of the Authority in so far as that is required for continuing its effect after that date.

subsection.content: If an act of performing a function or exercising a power by or on behalf of the Registrar is in force immediately before the specified date, or is to take effect on or after that date, the act has effect as if the function were performed or the power were exercised by the Authority in so far as that is required for continuing its effect after that date.

subsection.leadIn: If, immediately before the specified date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for anything referred to in subsection (5);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a request for the performance of a function or exercise of power referred to in subsection (6); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an application or request of a similar nature made to the Registrar,

subsection.continued: has not been disposed of, it is to be regarded as an application or request to the Authority, and is to be disposed of accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: If a form, document or instrument (including a form, document or instrument referred to in subsection (5) issued or made by or on behalf of the Registrar for the performance of the Registrar’s function under the repealed Ordinance)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was specified, prescribed, printed or duplicated for use in connection with the repealed Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is in force immediately before the specified date,

subsection.continued: it may be so used even if it contains a reference to the Registrar, and that reference is to be construed as a reference to the Authority.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Transfer of Registrar’s records to Authority

subsection.content: All records that are in the Registrar’s custody and are, in the opinion of the Authority, required for it to perform its functions under this Ordinance must be transferred from the Registrar to the Authority on or before the specified date.

In relation to a record transferred under this section, all the rights and obligations of the Registrar subsisting immediately before the transfer are to be transferred to the Authority on the transfer of the record.
The Authority must ensure that there are in place proper procedures and systems to safeguard against unauthorized access to, or unauthorized use of, the records transferred under this section.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to personal data transferred under this section—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the Authority must ensure that the data is used, disclosed and retained for the purpose for which the data was to be used at the time of the collection and the performance of its functions under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data may, on and after the date on which the data is transferred, exercise in relation to the Authority any power under the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486) that the Commissioner could have, immediately before that date, exercised in relation to the Registrar for a breach or alleged breach by the Registrar of a requirement under that Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The transfer of a record by the Registrar to the Authority under this section does not amount to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a breach of duty of confidentiality to which the Registrar is subject immediately before the transfer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a contravention by the Authority or the Registrar of the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486).

section.name: s31
section.heading: Costs and witness expenses under repealed Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: immediately before the specified date, the Registrar has not received the sum ordered to be paid under section 28 of the repealed Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on or after the specified date, the Authority orders a person to pay a sum in accordance with section 28 of the repealed Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the sum received on or after that date is to be paid into the funds of the Authority.

subsection.content: If, on or after the specified date, the Authority decides to pay any witness at any investigation in accordance with section 26 of the repealed Ordinance, the expense is to be paid by the Authority.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Other matters not yet determined by Registrar

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies if, immediately before the specified date, the Registrar is dealing with a matter under the repealed Ordinance and has not decided whether to—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.leadIn: approve an application made under the repealed Ordinance—

subparagraph.content: for amending a pre-existing licence;
for issuing a duplicate of a pre-existing licence;
for issuing a copy of or extract from any entry in that register; or
for certifying a copy of or extract from any entry in that register.

subsection.content: On and after the specified date, the Authority is to deal with the matter in accordance with the repealed Ordinance as if section 3 of Schedule 11 had not been enacted.

Without limiting subsection (2), if the Authority is satisfied that an application referred to in subsection (1)(c)(ii) for a duplicate licence complies with the repealed Ordinance, the Authority may issue a business permit to the applicant.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 5
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: *specified date (指明日期) means the commencement date of section 3 of Schedule 11.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Disciplinary Powers of Travel Industry Council

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the case has not been disposed of by the Compliance Committee of the Travel Industry Council before the specified date.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), on and after the specified date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Compliance Committee of the Travel Industry Council ceases to have power to deal with the case; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the case may instead only be dealt with by the Authority under Parts 6 and 7 by reference to the applicable rules.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Appeal not made to Appeal Board of Travel Industry Council before specified date

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), if—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: the person has not made the appeal before the specified date; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the period within which the person may make the appeal under the applicable rules has not expired on the specified date,

subsection.continued: on and after that date, the person may not make the appeal, but may instead make an appeal against the decision within that period under Part 8.

subsection.content: If the person makes the appeal under subsection (1), Part 8, with necessary modifications, applies in relation to the appeal.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Appeal not yet determined by Appeal Board of Travel Industry Council

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a decision was made by the Compliance Committee of the Travel Industry Council before the specified date in relation to a specified person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an appeal against the decision—

subparagraph.content: has been made to the Appeal Board of the Travel Industry Council; but
has not been disposed of before the specified date.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 23 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), on and after the specified date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Appeal Board of the Travel Industry Council ceases to have power to deal with the appeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appeal may instead only be dealt with by an appeal board under Part 8 as if the appeal were made under that Part.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (2)(b), Part 8, with necessary modifications, applies in relation to the appeal.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Effect of disciplinary order made by Travel Industry Council
section.leadIn: Subject to sections 35 and 36 of this Schedule, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Travel Industry Council has made a disciplinary order against a specified person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the order is in force immediately before the specified date,

section.continued: on and after that date, the order is to continue in force, until the expiry of the period (if any) specified by the Council in respect of the order, as if the order were made under Part 7.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Records and Assistance Required from Travel Industry Council

section.name: s38
section.heading: Travel Industry Council to provide records and assistance to Authority

subsection.leadIn: On or before the specified date, the Travel Industry Council must provide the Authority with records and assistance that the Authority requires for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ascertaining whether a person is a specified person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: considering any outstanding application—

subparagraph.content: for a licence or duplicate licence under the repealed Ordinance;
for a tourist guide pass;
for a tour escort pass;
for the renewal of a pre-existing licence;
for the renewal of a pre-existing tourist guide pass; or
for the renewal of a pre-existing tour escort pass;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: compiling a register of every person who is or may be—

subparagraph.content: taken to be a licensed tour escort under section 15(1) or 21(3) of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: considering whether a person is suitable to hold a travel agent licence, tourist guide licence or tour escort licence; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: compiling a record of—

subparagraph.content: the disciplinary orders that have been made by the Travel Industry Council.

subsection.content: The records and assistance must be provided to the Authority in the way, and within the time, specified by the Authority.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Records to be provided under section 38 of Schedule 10

subsection.content: In relation to a record provided by the Travel Industry Council to the Authority under section 38 of this Schedule, all the rights and obligations of the Council subsisting immediately before the provision are to be transferred to the Authority on the provision of the record.

The Authority must ensure that there are in place proper procedures and systems to safeguard against unauthorized access to, or unauthorized use of, the records provided under section 38 of this Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to personal data provided under section 38 of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486) applies as if the data had been received by the Authority rather than the Travel Industry Council;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority must ensure that the data is used, disclosed and retained for the purposes set out in that section and the performance of its functions under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data may, on and after the date on which the data is transferred, exercise in relation to the Authority any power under the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486) that the Commissioner could have, immediately before that date, exercised in relation to the Travel Industry Council for a breach or alleged breach by the Council of a requirement under that Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The provision of a record by the Travel Industry Council to the Authority under section 38 of this Schedule does not amount to—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a contravention by the Authority or the Travel Industry Council of the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486).

section.name: s40
section.heading: Travel Industry Council to provide documents to Authority

subsection.leadIn: On or before the specified date, the Travel Industry Council must provide the Authority with a copy of the following documents—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Memorandum and Articles of Association of the Council;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicable rules.

subsection.content: The documents must be provided to the Authority in the way, and within the time, specified by the Authority.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Authority may upload documents to Internet or similar electronic network
section.content: The Authority may, after receiving the documents under section 40 of this Schedule, make the content of the documents available for inspection by the public, free of charge, through the Internet or a similar electronic network.

part.name: P6
part.heading: Travel Industry Compensation Fund Management Board

section.name: s42
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 6
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: Board (管委會) means the Travel Industry Compensation Fund Management Board that is—(a)established by section 32B of the repealed Ordinance; and(b)in existence immediately before the specified date;
*specified date (指明日期) means the commencement date of section 3 of Schedule 11.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Transfer of Board’s Assets, Liabilities and Records to Authority

section.name: s43
section.heading: Transfer of Board’s assets and liabilities to Authority

subsection.content: All assets and liabilities of the Board are, on the specified date, to be transferred to and vested in the Authority’s separate account for the Compensation Fund.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), the following are to become the property of the Authority on the specified date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the money that, immediately before the specified date, constituted the pre-existing fund;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if any money of the pre-existing fund had been invested, any such investment.

subsection.content: All money or investments that become the property of the Authority under subsection (2) and that were, immediately before the specified date, standing in the books of any bank, or were registered in the books of any bank, corporation or company in the name of the Board are to be transferred in those books by the bank, corporation or company into the name of the Authority.
The Authority must deposit the money that becomes its property under this section into its separate account for the Compensation Fund.

Every contract that was made and is in force immediately before the specified date between the Board and any person is to continue in force on and after that date, but is to be construed and have effect as if the Authority were substituted for the Board and the contract is enforceable by or against the Authority accordingly.

Without affecting subsection (5), any right of the Board as regards the repayment of the whole or a part of any debt or the payment of interest, which was so in force, and chose in action relating to any such right is, under this subsection, to be transferred to and vested in the Authority.

Despite any provisions to the contrary in the Board’s constitution governing the winding up or dissolution of the Board, and despite the provisions of any other Ordinance, the Board is deemed to be dissolved on the specified date under the relevant legal procedures applicable to a company.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Transfer of Board’s records to Authority

subsection.content: All records that are in the Board’s custody and are, in the opinion of the Authority, required for it to perform its functions under this Ordinance must be transferred from the Board to the Authority on or before the specified date.

In relation to a record transferred under this section, all the rights and obligations of the Board subsisting immediately before the transfer are to be transferred to the Authority on the transfer of the record.
The Authority must ensure that there are in place proper procedures and systems to safeguard against unauthorized access to, or unauthorized use of, the records transferred under this section.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to personal data transferred under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486) applies as if the data had been received by the Authority rather than the Board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority must ensure that the data is used, disclosed and retained for the purpose for which the data was to be used at the time of the collection and the performance of its functions under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data may, on and after the date on which the data is transferred, exercise in relation to the Authority any power under the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486) that the Commissioner could have, immediately before that date, exercised in relation to the Board for a breach or alleged breach by the Board of a requirement under that Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The transfer of a record by the Board to the Authority under this section does not amount to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a breach of duty of confidentiality to which the Board is subject immediately before the transfer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a contravention by the Authority or the Board of the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486).

subsection.leadIn: If, immediately before the specified date, any legal proceedings to which the Board is a party are pending, on and after that date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority is substituted as a party to the proceedings in lieu of the Board; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proceedings are to continue as if the Authority had always been the party.

subsection.leadIn: If, immediately before the specified date, any legal proceedings instituted on behalf of the Board are pending, on and after that date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority is substituted as a party to the proceedings in lieu of the Board; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proceedings are to continue as if the Authority had always been the party.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: former application (先前申請) means an application for an ex gratia payment made under section 32E of the repealed Ordinance.

subsection.content: If a determination has been made under the repealed Ordinance in respect of a former application to pay an ex gratia payment, but the payment has not been made before the specified date, the Authority is to make the payment under section 145(1)(b).

subsection.leadIn: If a former application has not been determined before the specified date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application is taken to be an application made to the Authority under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority is to determine the application, and may pay to the applicant an ex gratia payment of an amount it considers appropriate, in accordance with the regulations made under section 149.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (5) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the person has not made the application before the specified date; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the period within which the person may make the application has not expired on the specified date.

subsection.leadIn: On and after the specified date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person may apply to the Authority for the ex gratia payment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person makes the application under paragraph (a), the Authority is to determine the application, and may pay to the person an ex gratia payment of an amount it considers appropriate, in accordance with the regulations made under section 149.
